https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/wXEvRF76wtuBpkhUHLPTtzaeLnd.jpg One of the last great German Expressionist films of the silent era, Joe Mayâ€™s Asphalt is a love story set in the traffic-strewn Berlin of the late 1920s. Starring the delectable Betty Amann in her most famous leading role, Asphalt is a luxuriously produced Ufa classic where tragic liaisons and fatal encounters are shaped alongside the constant roar of traffic.
